intro: Cyanea leptostegia var. velutina, commonly known as the velvet leaf Cyanea, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green foliage. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, often clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, commonly found in mesic forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
